sys_hub_action_type_definition.copied_from_name: Copy of Get All Jobs From View
sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves all jobs from a view on the Jenkins Server. The retrieved information will have Class and Name of top level jobs.

Inputs:

  • View Name - Name of the view from which to retrieve all the jobs. E.g. testView.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of the parent folder under which the view exists. E.g. TestFolder1/TestFolder2/.

Outputs:

  • Job Type - Type(Class) of the job.
  • Job Lists - Will be set to the list of jobs retrieved from view.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Either parent Folder Path or View Name doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • View name doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • Parent folder path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • Provided View Name does not exist.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.

Additional Notes:

  • The output parameter "Job List" will be empty if there are no jobs in the view or the view is inaccessible.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action retrieves all jobs from a view on the Jenkins Server. The retrieved information will have Class and Name of top level jobs.

Inputs:

  • View Name - Name of the view from which to retrieve all the jobs. E.g. testView.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of the parent folder under which the view exists. E.g. TestFolder1/TestFolder2/.

Outputs:

  • Job Type - Type(Class) of the job.
  • Job Lists - Will be set to the list of jobs retrieved from view.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Either parent Folder Path or View Name doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • View name doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • Parent folder path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • Provided View Name does not exist.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.

Additional Notes:

  • The output parameter "Job List" will be empty if there are no jobs in the view or the view is inaccessible.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
